title: Number of cigarettes smoked daily in the United Kingdom ( UK ) 2015
summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 has 12.0 times less Share of respondents than Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 which is the highest.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
The maximum Share of respondents 24.0 is found at Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 and the minimum is found at 31 to 50 where Number of cigarettes is 2.0.
mid_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
Number of cigarettes 31 to 50 has 12.0 times less Share of respondents than Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 which is the highest.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Number of cigarettes in the x axis and Share of respondents in the y axis.
Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has the highest Share of respondents and 31 to 50 has the lowest Share of respondents.
The second highest Share of respondents is appeared to be the Number of cigarettes 1 to 5.
The maximum Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has got 12.0 times higher Share of respondents than the minimum Number of cigarettes 31 to 50.
Share of respondents at Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 is 24.0 , second place is 1 to 5 at 23.0, and thirdly is 11 to 15 at 22.0.
The Number of cigarettes 6 to 10 has 1.86 times more Share of respondents than average.
Summing up the values of all Number of cigarettess, we get total 103.0.
